articles.author: Joe Cash
articles.description: China's imports and exports fell much faster than expected in July as weaker demand threatens recovery prospects in the world's second-largest economy, heightening pressure for authorities to release fresh stimulus to steady growth.
articles.title: China's trade slumps, threatening recovery prospects

articles.author: Dawn Chmielewski, Krystal Hu
articles.description: Walt Disney (DIS.N) has created a task force to study artificial intelligence and how it can be applied across the entertainment conglomerate, even as Hollywood writers and actors battle to limit the industry's exploitation of the technology.
articles.title: Disney creates task force to explore AI and cut costs - sources

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: Two U.S. lawmakers on Tuesday asked the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to address questions about potential security concerns involving cellular modules made by Chinese companies including Quectel (603236.SS) and Fibocom Wireless (300638.SZ).
articles.title: Two US lawmakers raise security concerns about Chinese cellular modules

articles.author: Bhanvi Satija, Mariam Sunny
articles.description: Eli Lilly (LLY.N) on Tuesday raised its annual forecasts as demand for new diabetes drug Mounjaro surges ahead of a decision on its use as a weight-loss treatment, with shares soaring 18% to a record high also helped by positive data from a rival drug.
articles.title: Lilly hits record high after Mounjaro fuels forecast raise, rival data

articles.author: Raphael Satter, Zeba Siddiqui
articles.description: A hydra-headed breach centered on a single American software maker has compromised data at about 600 organizations worldwide, according to cyber analyst tallies corroborated by Reuters.
articles.title: Analysis: MOVEit hack spawned around 600 breaches but isn't done yet - cyber analysts

articles.author: Chris Prentice
articles.description: U.S. regulators on Tuesday fined nine Wall Street companies, including Wells Fargo (WFC.N), BNP Paribas (BNPP.PA) and Société Générale (SOGN.PA) $549 million over employees' use of personal messaging apps to discuss deals, trades and other business.
articles.title: US regulators fine Wall Street firms $549 mln in latest round of texting probe

articles.author: Gus Trompiz
articles.description: French wine production in 2023 is expected to be near the average of the last five years, with a favourable outlook in Champagne and Burgundy contrasting that in disease-hit Bordeaux, the French farm ministry said.
articles.title: Mixed year for French wine as champagne flows, Bordeaux hit

articles.author: Bansari Kamdar, Johann Cherian
articles.description: Wall Street tumbled on Tuesday in a broad sell-off led by financial stocks after Moody's downgraded several U.S. banks, though drugmakers rose on Eli Lilly's strong results and positive data from Novo Nordisk's obesity treatment.
articles.title: Wall St falls as Moody's bank downgrades spark broad sell-off

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Alexandra Ulmer, Tim Reid
articles.description: Republican U.S. presidential candidate Ron DeSantis replaced his campaign manager on Tuesday as the Florida governor tries to reboot his flagging bid to overtake front-runner Donald Trump in the race for his party's 2024 nomination.
articles.title: Republican Ron DeSantis, in need of a momentum shift, ousts campaign chief

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iraq's official media regulator on Tuesday ordered all media and social media companies operating in the Arab state not to use the term "homosexuality" and instead to say "sexual deviance," the regulator said.
articles.title: Iraq bans media from using term ‘homosexuality’, says they must use ‘sexual deviance’
